EmailTemplate.subject: Turbonomic Top Ten Features #8: Projected Improvement Chart
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{Lead.First Name}},
You've arrived #8 of 10 Turbonomic Top Features! We hope this series has been useful in helping you evaluate Turbonomic's Application Performance Control for your organization. Of course, if at any time you want to accelerate your learning, you can visit the Green Circle Community <[[https://greencircle.turbonomic.com/welcome?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-HybridCloud&utm_content=Mid08]]> and gain tips and tricks from real Turbonomic customers and evaluators just like you. Feature #8: Projected Improvement Chart
Turbonomic's Projected Improvement Chart answers the following question:
- What improvements will I realize from executing the Turbonomic Actions?
Step-By-Step: Projected Improvement Chart
The following steps will guide you through the Projected Improvement Chart (panel expanded by clicking the double arrow):
- Projected Improvements appears in the bottom of the Assure Service Performance dashboard, and offers flexibility to view the projected improvements of Hosts, Storage, and Virtual Machines on multiple metrics:
- Host: Utilization Index (UI), Memory, CPU, IO, Network, VM Density
- Storage: Utilization Index (UI), Datastore Utilization, Datastore IOPS - VM: Utilization Index (UI), vCPU, vMem, vStorage
- Click on the Gear Icon to change the name or scope of the Projected Improvements dashboard - For all metrics, vertical bars represent the current utilization, or selected metric, of Hosts, Storage, and Virtual Machines; and the green line shows the expected improvements from taking Turbonomic Actions
